name: Boricua Space
overview:
Boricua Space Puerto Rican Alliance is a Puerto Rican social network established on April 14, 2008 by Mario Vidal Fernandez, Chief Executive Officer of PRA Enterprises and founder of the company. This network is a community of Puerto Ricans from Puerto Rico and many locations world wide. Boricua Space develops a new generation for it’s people, creating an environment familiar to their family and culture.

Mario Vidal Fernandez, CEO of PRA Enterprises, organization aiming towards web design, music production, social and cultural networking. PRAâ€™s future goals are to bring world wide support to medicine, poverty, Internet telecommunications, and other future projects.

On April 14, 2008, PRA Enterprises established the first cultural social network called â€œBoricua Space Puerto Rican Allianceâ€. Boricua Space was created to bring Puerto Rico on the net, to bring Puerto Ricans to a new home on the internet. It also was an inspiration towards the Latin genre Reggaeton. Boricua Space became very popular for its music and its purpose for bringing Puerto Ricans under one network. PRA Enterprises is also a music record label which distributes the artist music on platforms such as the popular iTunes music store.

Our goals:

We have a set goals to improve the quality of this network as well as it’s structure and purpose. Our goals are:

  1. To bring the Puerto Rican culture and it’s people under one network created for Puerto Ricans.
  2. Become the center of Latin/Puerto Rican music.
  3. Become the #1 Puerto Rican network provider of music artist’s source.
